document_notes.text:
This update for ImageMagick fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:
- CVE-2017-9439: A memory leak was found in the function ReadPDBImage incoders/pdb.c (bsc#1042826)
- CVE-2017-9440: A memory leak was found in the function ReadPSDChannelin coders/psd.c (bsc#1042812)
- CVE-2017-9501: An assertion failure could cause a denial of service via a crafted file (bsc#1043289)
- CVE-2017-11403: ReadMNGImage function in coders/png.c has an out-of-order CloseBlob call, resulting
  in a use-after-free via acrafted file (bsc#1049072)
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: The ReadMNGImage function in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has an out-of-order CloseBlob call, resulting in a use-after-free via a crafted file.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: In ImageMagick 7.0.5-5, a memory leak was found in the function ReadPDBImage in coders/pdb.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

notes.text: In ImageMagick 7.0.5-7 Q16, an assertion failure was found in the function LockSemaphoreInfo, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.
